ECClass.description: This class defines instances of electrical items such as devices, cables, raceway, etc.

ECClass.description: An artefact and electrical cable conduit consisting of a mesh base and two sides
A cable basket section that is a bend
A cable basket bend that is fixed.

A cable basket fixed bend where the angle between the vectors normal to the end planes is 60 degrees.
A cable basket fixed bend where the angle between the vectors normal to the end planes is 90 degrees.
A cable basket section that is a cross
A cable basket bend that is adjustable.
A 'cable basket section' and an 'elbow' that changes the direction of cables between horizontal and vertical
A cable basket riser that changes the elevation of cables at non-standard bend angles.
A cable basket riser that changes the elevation of cables running inside the bend
A cable basket riser that changes the elevation of cables running outside the bend
A cable basket section intended to join cable baskets having different width
A cable basket reducer that is reduced in the center.
A cable basket reducer that is reduced on the left hand side.
A cable basket reducer that is reduced on the right hand side.
A cable basket section that is joint between 3 other cable basket sections
A cable basket tee that changes the size of the cable basket connecting to the leg of the tee.
A cable basket section that is a straight length
A component of structural significance
A physical object that is capable of keeping some other thing from falling, sinking or failing.

ECProperty.description: A force that is constant over time
A force that is acting on a physical object that acts as a support of another physical object.
Distance from pipe center line to the base of the support
Support Point on which the stress analysis is to be performed
Support Point on which the stress analysis is to be performed
Support Point on which the stress analysis is to be performed

ECClass.description: A support that is horizontally fixed at one end only, spaced at intervals, and on which cables rest

An artefact and electrical cable conduit that is a part of a closed wiring system of generally circular cross section for insulated conductors and/or cables in electrical or communication installations, allowing them to be drawn in and/or replaced.

ECProperty.description: Type of the spacer used to support conduit runs inside the duct bank

ECClass.description: A cable conduit section where the angle between the vectors normal to the end planes differs from 180 degrees
A cable conduit section that is cross formed
A cable conduit section intended to join cable conduit sections of different diameters
A cable conduit section that is a straight line

Measured as positive upwards. it is either the distance above the earth' surface or above a reference plane subparallel to the earth' surface. Relative to the point specified by the TRANSFORMATION_MATRIX
Volume of material (e.g. concrete) used to form the solid. May be less than the geometric volume of the element in case this component contains other objects.
